intro: Boechera perennans subsp. centrifendleri, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous areas.
